alert.note: Alert for Guernsey (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:30PM EST until February 20 at 4:25PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...Ohio... Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC059-191600- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0016.000000T0000Z-220220T2125Z/ /CDIO1.1.ER.000000T0000Z.220219T0600Z.220220T1525Z.NO/ 730 PM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wills Creek at Cambridge. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Overflowing of poor drainage and low lying areas will result in minor flooding along wills creek. At 16.0 feet, Basement flooding begins through floor drains and other sewer connections. Local interruptions in sanitary service may occur along Gordon`s Run from 3rd Street to 6th Street. At 17.0 feet, Water overflows wills Creek Valley Road to a depth of 2 feet. Water reaches a depth of 1 foot on North Eighth Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Friday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 03/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
